questions.text: Which of the following is a risk reduction measure before the impact of a disaster-?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Disaster Preparedness As per the disaster cycle, there are two primary phases of any disaster management- The risk reduction phase before a disaster & Recovery phase after a disaster. The risk reduction phase includes: Mitigation Preparedness The recovery phase after a disaster includes: Disaster response Rehabilitation Reconstruction

questions.text: In a rescue operation after the collapse of a building, five people were found dead, 15 were found in a moribund state, 20 sustained life-threatening injuries and required surgery, and 55 had minor casualties requiring dressing and stitches. Which patients will get priority in the treatment in this situation?

options.label: A
options.text: First come, the first treated principle will be followed

options.label: B
options.text: Patients who required dressing and stitches

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Patients who required surgery In a disaster, when the quantity and severity of injuries overwhelm the operative capacity of health facilities, the principle of first come, first treated is not followed. Rapidly classifying the injured based on the severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival is done, known as triage. Patients who require urgent, immediate medical or surgical treatment without which they would die are given priority. This is followed by patients who can survive without surgery for 6-24 hours. Next priority is given to ambulatory patients with no life-threatening injuries who need dressings or stitches only Least priority is given to dead or moribund patients.

questions.text: Read the following statements regarding disaster cycle and answer the following question accordingly- A. Disaster mitigation is a risk reduction measure before the occurrence of a disaster B. Response to a disaster includes triage, tagging, identification of dead and relief activities C. Disaster preparedness is short term development activities to strengthen overall capacity & capability of nation to manage efficiently all types of emergencies. D. Rehabilitation is the final phase in a disease that leads to restoration of pre-disaster conditions. Select the correct answer from the given below code
questions.correct_answer: B. A, B, D are correct
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A, B, D are correct Statement A. Mitigation is defined as measures taken to reduce both the effects of disaster itself and the vulnerable conditions leading to it in order to reduce the scale of a future disaster. It is an important measure in the pre-disaster phase. Statement B. After the impact of a disaster, search rescue and first aid provisions are made along with triage, tagging and identification of dead. Statement C. Disaster preparedness is a programme of long-term development activities whose goal is to strengthen the overall capacity and capability of a country to manage efficiently all types of emergencies. Statement D. The final phase in managing a disaster is the restoration of pre-disaster conditions which is also known as Rehabilitation. However, it starts from the very first moment of a disaster So, statements A, B & D are correct.

questions.text: Identify the missing element step in the disaster cycle:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Rehabilitation In a disaster cycle, after the disaster impact, response action is initiated followed by rehabilitation which is efforts that lead to pre-disaster conditions. In first weeks after disaster, the pattern of health needs, will change rapidly, moving from casualty treatment to more routine primary health care.

questions.text: The infamous Bhopal Gas Tragedy is an example of which type of disaster-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Man-made disaster India saw world’s worst man-made disaster in 1984, when methyl isocyanate gas leaked at Union Carbide Pesticide Plant in Bhopal killing more than 3000. People are still suffering from variety of disease, as an after effect of this tragedy. Natural disasters are the one triggered by natural hazards. For eg. Flood, landslides, avalanche, cyclone, earthquake etc. Hydrological disasters are a type of natural disaster which include flood, landslides, cyclones etc. Bioterrorism attack is the deliberate release of viruses, bacteria, or other biological agents to cause illness or death.

questions.text: Read the following statements and answer accordingly- A. Flood is the most common type of disaster occurring in the world B. In the event of a disaster, the principle of first come, first treated is followed to manage the patients C. WHO recommends the use of typhoid and cholera vaccines in routine use in endemic areas after a disaster Select the correct answer from the given below code
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A is correct Statement: A . Hydrological disasters, of which floods are the most common type of disasters occurring in the world. Statement: B . In a disaster, the principle of first come, first treated must be followed to manage the patients. Priority is set based on the severity of injuries and the likelihood of survival with prompt medical intervention. This is known as triage. Statement: C . WHO does not recommend using typhoid and cholera vaccines routinely in endemic areas after a Vaccination programme requires a large number of workers who could be employed elsewhere.

questions.text: In mass casualties during wartime, the following strategy is employed to manage the injured-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reverse triage Under triage: It refers to underestimating the urgency of the condition of a person arriving in casualty and not prioritising his/her management over that of a patient with less urgent needs. CDC puts the threshold as a 20% acceptable risk of under-triage. Over triage: It refers to unintentionally overestimating the urgency of the condition of a person arriving in casualty and prioritising that person’s management over that of a patient with more urgent needs. Reverse Triage: In cases of war, those with less critical injuries are treated first so that they can return to the battlefield as early as possible Triage Sieve: Quick survey to separate the dead and the walking from the injured.

questions.text: All of the following are mitigation measures in case of a disaster EXCEPT-

options.label: B
options.text: Developing proper design & building codes to protect the water supply, sewage system in the event of a disaster.

options.label: D
options.text: Improving the structural quality of the buildings

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Conducting mock drills regularly Mitigation is defined as measures to reduce both the effects of the disaster itself and the vulnerable conditions leading to it to reduce the scale of a future disaster. The following are the activities undertaken in the mitigation program- Provision of early warning systems. We are developing proper design & building codes to protect the water supply and sewage system in the event of a Improving the structural quality of the buildings and constructions Dissemination of information, sensitisation and training of personnel involved in the operation, administration, and maintenance of facilities Conducting mock drills with the active participation of health staff is a Disaster Preparedness activity whose objective is to develop measures that enable individuals, communities and government to respond rapidly and effectively to a disaster.

questions.text: After the disaster impact, the most immediate step is-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Response Most injuries are sustained during the disaster impact, and thus the greatest need for emergency care occurs in the first few hours. So, disaster response is the first immediate thing that needs to be done, including search and rescue, first aid, triage, stabilisation of victims, hospital treatment etc. Mitigation involves measures designed either to prevent hazards from causing emergencies or to lessen the likely effects of crises. Rehabilitation is the measures taken for restoration to pre-disaster conditions. It should begin after the initial response phase has already started. Reconstruction should begin once the medical casualties have been met and the situation is controlled.

questions.text: As a public health specialist, you are a part of the medical Team after a flood affects a village. Which of the following measures would you suggest as per WHO recommendations-

options.label: A
options.text: Mass vaccination against cholera and typhoid

options.label: C
options.text: Provision of safe potable water and proper sanitation

questions.correct_answer: C. Provision of safe potable water and proper sanitation
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Provision of safe potable water and proper sanitation WHO does not recommend typhoid and cholera vaccines for routine use in endemic areas. Vaccination programme requires many workers who could be better employed elsewhere. Significant increases in tetanus incidence have not occurred after natural disasters. Mass vaccination of the population against tetanus is usually unnecessary. It is crucial to prevent water contamination to avoid waterborne infections after the flood. So, it is essential to disinfect water by chlorination and ensure proper sanitation by safely disposing of faeces and not allowing them to contaminate the water source.

questions.text: During a disaster, rapidly classifying the injured based on the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention is a part of the:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Triage Triage: Consists of rapidly classifying the injured' based on the severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention First come, first serve is NOT followed in emergencies Triage system: Most commonly uses FOUR colour code system I Red (Highest Priority): Immediate resuscitation or limb/life-saving surgery in the next 6 hours ii Yellow (High Priority): Possible resuscitation or limb/life-saving surgery in the next 24 hours iii Green (Low Priority): Minor illness/ ambulatory patients iv Black (Least Priority): Dead and dying patients Tagging: This is the procedure where identification, age, place of origin, triage category, diagnosis and initial treatment are tagged on to every victim of disaster through a colour coding Mitigation: Measures designed to prevent hazards from causing an emergency or lessen the crisis's effects.

questions.text: All of the following are United Nations Agencies providing humanitarian health assistance during a disaster EXCEPT-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

CARE Several international or regional agencies have established special funds, procedures and offices to provide humanitarian assistance. United Nations agencies are United Nations Office for Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) ii. WHO iii. UNICEF, iv. World Food Programme (WFP), v. FAO. CARE (Cooperative for Assistance and Relief Everywhere) is a Non-Governmental Organization delivering emergency relief.
